summary: This document is a 30-minute check sheet and official count slips from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit, dated August 9, 2019. It records routine inmate observation rounds and staff signatures, indicating standard prison operational procedures for an inmate in a locked-down status.

events.title: MCC Special Housing Unit Monitoring
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks and official counts conducted for an inmate in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is dated August 9, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody at the MCC.
It is a standard prison check sheet for an inmate in a locked-down status (e.g., administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) in the Special Housing Unit.
The form requires staff to observe the inmate at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule, with rounds no more than 40 minutes apart.
The document contains multiple official count slips and signature lines for correctional staff, but no staff or inmate names are legibly provided in the text.
The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting it relates to the monitoring of Jeffrey Epstein prior to his death.
